intro: Deuterocohnia pedicellata, commonly known as the cushion fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a small, evergreen fern that forms dense, compact mats of foliage. The plant is characterized by its short, erect rhizomes and clustered fronds that are typically dark green and leathery. Native to South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique appearance and compact growth make it a popular choice for rock gardens and as a decorative plant in moist, well-drained soils.
